abstract: The Federal Reserve has taken a laudable step on reining in foreign banks but continues to tolerate questionable choices for the board of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, an economist writes.
snippet: The Federal Reserve has taken a laudable step on reining in foreign banks but continues to tolerate questionable choices for the board of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz professor of entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of “White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.”

headline.main: Two Steps Forward and One Step Back for the Federal Reserve

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
